name: Luca Gaeta
bio:
As a visiting research fellow at the MoST research unit, Luca Gaeta analyzed urban hybrid spaces and related planning issues between March and June 2025.

Beyond visiting FBK, Luca is a full professor of urban planning at Politecnico di Milano, Department of Architecture and Urban Studies, and was chair of the PhD programme in Urban planning, design and policy until December 2024.

name: Simone Basso
bio:
Simone Basso was a Senior Technologist at the MoST unit from January to August 2025. He managed the development of the DT Model evaluation engine.

Before joining FBK, Simone was measuring internet censorship at the Open Observatory of Network Interference, internet performance at Measurement Lab, and network neutrality at the Nexa Center for Internet & Society.

name: Piergiorgio Vivenzio
bio:
Piergiorgio Vivenzio is a PhD student in Urban and Regional Development at the Politecnico di Torino.

He was a visiting researcher at FBK's MoST unit from December 2024 to May 2025. He studied and developed a dynamic simulation model of student housing distribution.

He holds a degree in Statistical and Economic Methods for Decision Making and has worked as a research fellow at the University of Turin. He has also collaborated with the startup MetroPolis SRL.

name: Guadalupe Sol Escalante
bio:
Guadalupe Escalante is a Geospatial Engineer from the National University of C贸rdoba, Argentina.

From March to July 2025, she did an internship at the MoST research unit, where she explored the contribution of remote sensing to digital twins projects.

Guadalupe is pursuing a Master's degree in Spatial Information Applications at the Gulich Institute (CONAE/UNC), where she is conducting this internship. She focuses on the study of territorial dynamics, has participated in projects at the Center for Territorial Studies (FCEFYN), and headed the Environmental Territorial Planning area at the Ministry of Environment of the Province of C贸rdoba, Argentina.
